page.title: 01Education
page.content: There are no schools in the area covered by this report. Children, unless educated privately, begin school at the Lady Joanna Thornhill School, Wye, at the beginning of the term following their fifth birthday. Special buses are provided by the Kent County Council to get the children to school, those living three miles plus from the school travelling free, while others may use the transport but pay a concessional fare. The children spend six years at Primary School and then those living at Crundale and within the boundary of the Canterbury area will go to schools in Canterbury selected to suit the child's academic ability. The others will go mainly to the Towers School, Ashford where they may move on to Upper School at the age of thirteen.
